Thanks. Sorry, I have been hoping for a big old thread with many pics ^^

So, the "close fly by" in Enceladus Geysers is for 28 october, expecting pics of flying shrimp slamming into the cameras for 30 october.

http://solarsystem.nasa.gov/finalflybys

http://saturn.jpl.nasa.gov/mission/flybys/enceladus20151028/

I still don't fully understand this "no necro under any circumstances ever" policy. If a topic becomes irrelevant and the thread dies, then the topic becomes relevant again, isn't it more convenient to use the existing thread wherein we can see and respond to people's old posts? That and I feel like it keeps the forum marginally neater.

I still don't fully understand this "no necro under any circumstances ever" policy.

That's because - from my understanding - that's not the policy. That 2-year-old thread had like 5 posts and didn't talk about Enceladus. It wasn't a general catch-all thread about Cassini either. It was about a single (albeit cool) photo. This has nothing to do with that so should not be posted there.

If Cassini took a 2nd photo, similar to the original, then that would be a reasonable - uh - reason to post there, and a valid necro.

5thHorseman's got it. The old thread was about a single pic captured by Cassini.

We certainly don't have a "no necro under any circumstances" policy, if a post adds substantial new content and is on topic then we leave it be (this one failed the second part).
http://www.ciclops.org/view_event/224/Enceladus-Flyby-Rev-223?js=1

Hopefully they'll also get some good photograph on the fissures ! Then we'll be able to tell, will Enceladus be dry in our lifetime (my lifetime) ?

Also, possible future landers.
Microorganisms are still life, which would annihilate everyone who says life is only on Earth. Enceladus life hype!
Nice animation of Cassini's second-to-last Enceladus flyby, scheduled for 11:25 am on October 28th. Cassini will dive into a plume at only 49 km from the ground (a record!).

Nice animation of Cassini's second-to-last Enceladus flyby, scheduled for 11:25 am on October 28th. Cassini will dive into a plume at only 49 km from the ground (a record!).

I am really looking foward to this one!!!!
I hope Cassini remembered its fishing rod.
JPL video about this:

It's going to be moving too fast. It'll be traveling at 8500 meters a second relative to the surface. If it hits a speck of dust or ice at that speed it will break. It's going through the plumes. Can we not sample the plumes from outside them? Like analyzing the spectrum or something? The spectrum is obvious, the plumes are ice and will be reflecting lots of light we can get a spectrum from. I don't know it it is worth sending Cassini into the plumes for this "flying shrimp hitting the camera" situation ().
It's going through the ring plane soon, and plunging straight into the atmosphere not long after if that doesn't kill it. A little bit of risk from a diffuse plume isn't much of an additional issue.

It's going to be moving too fast. It'll be traveling at 8500 meters a second relative to the surface. If it hits a speck of dust or ice at that speed it will break. It's going through the plumes. Can we not sample the plumes from outside them? Like analyzing the spectrum or something? The spectrum is obvious, the plumes are ice and will be reflecting lots of light we can get a spectrum from. I don't know it it is worth sending Cassini into the plumes for this "flying shrimp hitting the camera" situation ().

It's the Kerbal way?

There is so much good stuff going on right now. I am eager to see what things we will discover. Wonderful times.

We certainly don't have a "no necro under any circumstances" policy

You could have me fooled.

You could have me fooled.

Perfect example: My Video thread. Also, my ModMan Configs thread. I reply to the video one every time I start a new series and the config one every time I write a new config. It's easily months for the videos (I tend to start a new series every major update) and I don't even know the last time I posted on the other one. But if I start a new series or write a new config, I'll update those threads without a thought and I can't imagine the moderators even considering that bad. Even if it's years later.
